required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of OCT Imaging on Decision Making During PCI in ACS Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Optical Coherence Tomography Imaging on Decision-making During Percutaneous Coronary Intervention in Patients Presented With Acute Coronary Syndromes

brief_summary.textblock: Optical coherence tomography (OCT) provides valuable information to guide percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) in acute coronary syndrome (ACS) regarding lesion preparation, stent sizing, and stent optimization.

detailed_description.textblock: OCT can be used in acute coronary syndrome (ACS). ACS has more complex culprit lesion morphologies and larger extent of coronary atherosclerosis compared with stable coronary artery disease. The detailed vascular information obtained by OCT may impact PCI in ACS, and which may improve acute results and late outcomes of PCI. Stent expansion immediately after PCI is a strong predictor of late outcomes of PCI, and it is associated with late clinical outcomes in many previous trials.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent difference in lumen expansion in stent treated lesion
primary_outcome.description: Compare residual percent diameter stenosis, percent area stenosis, and acute lumen gain between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical outcomes at 1 year follow up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 1 year following the index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac death, MI, clinical-driven target-lesion revascularization (TLR), and stroke

arm_group.description: PCI procedure was done with intra-coronary imaging OCT.
PCI procedure was done without any intra-coronary imaging assistance, guided by angiography alone

intervention.description: using optical coherence tomography imaging to help PCI procedure

study_pop.textblock: Patient either underwent PCI with angiography alone or OCT guided and is grouped accordingly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients presented with acute coronary syndrome.
- PCI was done to them with stent implantation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multivessel PCI at the index procedure.
- Patients with ACS due to graft failure post CABG.
- Patients treated with no stent implantation.
